bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 1896

div1.p: Lazear writes about making expeditions into the California mountains. He will leave in two weeks for San Francisco, and plans to meet Sweitzer in Canada.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 1896
div1.p:
Your letter
of July 26 came last
Tuesday. I was glad
to hear all the
news about Hatley.
There is nothing new
to be told here.
We make expeditions
to the mountains and
go fishing and shooting.
The rest of the
time we read.
Altogether the time.
goes very rapidly.
The absence of rain
is rather an advantage.
It makes it dusty
to be sure, but then
one can make plans
without fear and
lie down on the ground
anywhere even early
in the morning.

It does not interfere with
the vegetable garden as they
have that perfectly irrigated
from the streams coming down
the mountains. Things can be
left out of doors, hammocks
books etc. It is a relief
to get rid of thunderstorms.

We expect to leave here in
two weeks. I shall stay
in San Francisco about a week
longer leaving about Sept. 1.
That will get me at Hatley
about Sep. 9 or 10. and we
can go on to Baltimore in a
day or two if you are ready
to go. Address next letter to San Fran.
